intro: Gilia lutea, commonly known as the yellow gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces bright yellow, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and hairy, with a distinctive appearance that aids in identification. Gilia lutea is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to arid environments.
